intro: Cassine kedarnathii, commonly known as Kedarnath's cassine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Indian subcontinent, particularly found in the Western Ghats and northeastern regions of India. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Cassine kedarnathii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
